dialogues.speaker: EXTREMELY TIGHT ON ELECTRONIC GUTS
dialogues.text: of a video camera. The screwdriver blade of a Swiss Army knife ENTERS FRAME, methodically tightening a row of screws. PULL BACK to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the backslope of a mound of rubble, a three-man TV crew (field producer, reporter, and cameraman, all wearing flak jackets) waits while the cameraman, JEFFREY TAYLOR, works to repair his malfunctioning minicam. Throughout this sequence, ROD, the reporter, types on a laptop computer, oblivious to what is happening around him. HOWARD, the field producer, lies on his stomach, peering cautiously over the crest of the rubble through binoculars. Beyond him we see an empty street. It is lined with buildings blasted by shells: a sawtooth wall in the f.g., a ruined high-rise at the end of the street, billboards in an unrecognizable foreign language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Jeff? Jeff finishes his repair job, snaps the minicam closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Jeff slips the knife back in his pocket, scrambles over the loose bricks and stones to a position next to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frightened woman lurks nervously in the shelter of the wall. She is young, in her early twenties, with shining dark hair down to her shoulders. She's carrying an armload of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff focuses the minicam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAMED in the viewfinder we see the frightened woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice legs. Jeff ignores Howard, PANS the minicam DOWN the street. In the viewfinder we see the flash of sun on metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of blasted windows. In one of the windows, a sniper crouches. Sunlight glitters on his rifle barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-rise. Top floor.        Window in the middle. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking through his binoculars)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on him. Stay on him.        Now go back to the woman. Now! Jeff swings the minicam and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the image blurs, then holds steady on the frightened woman. Nervously, she peeks around the corner. HOWARD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the sniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay tight on the sniper. Jesus -- look at him! He's about fourteen! Don't lose this! Jeff kneels on the ridge, minicam on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff's minicam ZOOMS IN ON the sniper. The sniper sees the woman peeking and gets his rifle in firing position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on her. If she runs, widen and try to get her and sniper in the same frame. Jeff turns his head away from the camera and stares at Howard. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said he sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.    Stay on her. Jeff looks to Rod for support but he's busy typing, oblivious. Jeff hesitates, then lifts the minicam to his eye again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sniper, taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened woman decides to make a dash for it.   She takes off her high-heeled shoes, inhales deeply, gathering herself to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff watches through his viewfinder: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) No... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened woman bolts, sprinting barefoot across the cobblestones, skirt lifted, slender legs flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff jumps to his feet, waves the minicam, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniper!   Sniper! Sni--

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The woman looks up in Jeff's direction, confused, breaking stride -- We hear a burst of automatic gunfire --

dialogues.speaker: RUINED HIGH-RISE
dialogues.text: In the window, the winking muzzle-flash of the sniper's AK-47.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The woman's body jolts from the impact of the bullets. The books go flying from her hand. She spins to the pavement, her hair billowing.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: just stands there, a shattered expression. The camera hangs at his side. He stares at the dead woman as a pool of dark blood expands around her body.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A 747 touches down on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late-model Jeep Cherokee is parked at the arrival curb. AMY TAYLOR, Jeff's wife, peers out from behind the wheel, scanning the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, carrying a single bag slung over his shoulder, emerges from the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Amy gets out of the car, grinning. Jeff sees her and hurries over. He drops his bag and they fall into each other's arms, kissing hungrily. These are two people passionately in love with each other. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here. Where's your equipment? Don't tell me you checked it? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up his bag) This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No camera? Jeff shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No nothing? Again Jeff shakes his head.       Amy arches an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest apartment in the Back Bay neighborhood. Not much furniture, but lots of books and CD's. On the walls, blow-ups of arty photographs -- Amy in modeling poses, plus many black-and-white scenery stills. Jeff's bag is unopened on the floor. We see two nearly full wine glasses on a table. The CAMERA TRACKS DOWN a hallway TO the open bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More framed photographs. Amy lies in bed, curled up against a pillow. The sheets are tangled in post-coital disarray, the only sign of disorder in this neatly arranged room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stirs, reaching her hand out toward the other side of the bed, which is empty. She opens her eyes, surprised to find herself alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff? No reply. Something catches her attention from across the room. She rises, pulls a loose robe around herself and pads over to a closed door. She knocks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walk-in closet has been converted into a small photographic darkroom. Moist 8 X 10 prints hang from a clothesline, bathed in a warm red glow. The images are moody black and white landscapes. Jeff stands over the developer, timing a print. Amy enters through a thick black curtain behind him. He doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep? Jeff shakes his head. Amy looks over his shoulder at a landscape photograph in the developing tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when you took that. We had fun on that trip, didn't we? Jeff nods.    Amy looks at him.     After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. I quit.   Walked out. end of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's   it? Jeff nods. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened back there wasn't your responsibility. You can't keep beating yourself up over it. He says nothing. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? You could have stopped that girl from getting killed? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand... He stops, lifts his eyes. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was different this time. He breaks off and pushes through the curtain.    She watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff pours himself a glass of milk. Amy enters, stands on the other side of the counter. Jeff doesn't meet her eyes. After a beat: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Reynolds. (a beat) He thinks I could still get the job at the San Diego station. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jeff, you didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it. Low pressure, a steady paycheck. So I shoot city council meetings -- how bad could it be? She looks at him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you really want -- or are you just running away? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's running? It's good money, full benefits. I'm tired of freelance. We could finally put some money in the bank. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'll never stand in your way. But you've worked so hard. Are you sure you want to throw it away? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw what away? Don't you get it? I don't do anything. I sit, I watch, I film -- I let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to let it happen. It's your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Amy.   It's my excuse. She looks at him, not understanding.       He hesitates. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl... it's like I was paralyzed. I wanted to do something, but I didn't. I just stood there and watched her get killed. He looks at her, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, babe, I need this.     Say yes and we'll take as long    as you want -- drive cross-country    and make a vacation out of it.     What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy looks at him, considering. We hear a faint RUSH OF WIND. Then it gets LOUDER... LOUDER... and --

dialogues.speaker: DAY AND NIGHT
dialogues.text: The metallic grill of the Cherokee explodes INTO FRAME as the car whooshes over us, hurtling down the Massachusetts Turnpike. In a SERIES OF SHOTS, with CREDITS OVER, we see landmarks form the cross-country trip: a Pennsylvania Dutch farmhouse, a smoke-spewing factory in Ohio, the Mississippi River, Kansas wheat fields, Loveland Pass and the Continental Divide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle of nowhere. Sand, weeds and sagebrush. A two-lane highway stretches to the horizon like a ribbon of asphalt. The Cherokee cruises along the road. Its Massachusetts plates seem out of place in this stark landscape. There are no other vehicles. MOVING CLOSER, we see that Jeff is driving.    Amy is sou asleep in the reclined passenger seat. In back, luggage, moving boxes, camera cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIR CONDITIONING WHISPERS. On the console are two empty Styrofoam McDonald's coffee cups and a state-of- the-art Nikon Camera. Jeff stretches in the driver's seat. He forces his eyes open, fighting sleep. He reaches for the coffee cup... it's empty. He glances into the back of the Jeep. There is a thermos of coffee on the back seat. Keeping one hand on the wheel, he reaches for the thermos and fumbles it to the floor. He strains to reach it. He doesn't notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow-moving Dodge Ram pickup truck is approaching the highway along a small road that cuts across the desert floor. The pickup, equipped with oversized tires, roll bar, and a CB whip antenna, bounces over the uneven terrain and turns onto the highway, stopping just before entering Jeff's lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff glances up just in time to see the Ram lurch into the road in front of him. Jeff drops the thermos and spins the wheel! Amy's eyes fly open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee goes into a wild looping skid. The Ram jerks to a halt as the Cherokee whips past, averting a collision by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff expels a breath. Amy turns to see the pickup stopped in the road. She looks at him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.     I took my eyes off the road. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing thermos on floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time we took a break, you know? Jeff nods, looks in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: PICKUP
dialogues.text: halted in the middle of the road. Inside, dimly-visible through tinted windows, are two figures in cowboy hats. The driver leans out the window and gives Jeff the finger.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: angry at himself.    He looks over at Amy. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pull over next chance we get. (a beat) Sorry... He glances in the rearview again, still a bit shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small desert gas station/mini-mart just off the highway. A sign over the building: "Last Gas For 30 Miles." The Cherokee is parked at the pumps, hood raised. Jeff comes out of the mini-mart, carrying a   plastic qua of oil. He unscrews the cap and starts to    fill the crankcase, careful not to spill on the new   engine. In the b.g., Amy is visible inside the store,   browsing a magazine rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy thumbs through a cheap tourist guide, The Desert Southwest. A TRUCK DRIVER stands nearby, perusing the magazines. He glances in Amy's direction, notices what she's reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On vacation? Amy looks up at him. He's 50ish, plain-looking, friendly, wearing a "U.S.A." logo baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.    We're moving, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereabouts? Amy hesitates. She's not used to talking with strangers, but the guy seems harmless enough. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California. We thought we'd take the scenic route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. In that case, you oughta try the Pass Road, 'bout thirty miles west. Real pretty, makes a loop through the hills, then hooks back up with the highway. Amy smiles politely, moves toward the cash register. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'll mention it to my husband. The Trucker tips his cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Good luck.   Enjoy the rest of your trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jeff continues pouring the oil, he doesn't notice the mud-streaked Dodge Ram pickup pulling up to the pumps behind him. The driver, EARL, climbs out. The other man remains in the cab with the smoked windows rolled up. Earl is a beefy man about Jeff's age. He wears a sweat- stained Western hat, cowboy boots and a T-shirt with the sleeves cut out to display his tattooed biceps. He saunters over to the Cherokee, stands there a beat, looking over Jeff's shoulder. Jeff senses something behind him, turns. His eyes widen as he sees Earl, recognizes the pickup as the one he nearly hit a few minutes before. Earl stares at him, unsmiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car. Jeff is in an awkward position. He's got a half-full upside-down bottle of oil in his hands. If he lifts it now, he'll spill on the engine. He turns his gaze back to the engine, decides to keep pouring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Earl steps around to the open passenger window, peers in. Jeff watches him, wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air, C.D., leather -- I guess you sprung for the whole nine yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again, out here, what you really need's a C.B. radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? The oil bottle empties    out. Relieved, Jeff pulls it aw and screws back on the    crankcase cap. He shuts the hoo with a thunk and moves    around to the side of the car t remove the gas nozzle    from the tank. Earl blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course, if you use a C.B., you gotta have a handle. Jeff says nothing.      This is not a friendly conversati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Shit-for-Brains? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn near killed us back there, boy. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, I didn't see you. You pulled out in front of me. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I did. I saw what happened. Looking past Earl, Jeff sees Amy come out of the mini- mart with a bag of groceries. He speaks carefully, anxious to avoid a confrontation. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if we just forget it, okay? I'm sorry it happened. I don't want any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     I bet you don't.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Earl glares at Jeff before turning away.    He passes Amy gives her a broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, ma'am. Caught this fellow tryin' to steal your Cherokee. Amy takes in the situation. She nods politely. Earl continues into the mini-mart. She approaches Jeff, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Guy in the truck. Thinks I tried to hit him. Jeff glances apprehensively at the man in the pickup, who has not moved during the scene. He looks back at the mini-mart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.   Just get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's just go. Jeff climbs in behind the wheel. Amy glances at him and gets in the car. Jeff keys the IGNITION and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jeff steers back onto the highway, he glances in the rear-view mirror, sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl coming out of the mini-mart, staring after the disappearing Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff shifts in his seat, relieved to be getting away from there. Amy watches the speedometer as it climbs to 75, then 80, then 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the Grand Prix, you know. Jeff releases his foot from the accelerator.     The need sinks back down to 65. She gives him a long contemplative look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Nothing. (pause) The guy was an asshole. Keeping an eye on the rear-view mirror, Jeff nods toward the grocery bag, trying to change the subject. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you get? Amy pulls out an assortment of candy bars and junk food. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junk food fiesta. Sno Balls, Yoo Hoo, Moon pies... can you believe they still make this stuff? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding. It's probably gourmet cuisine around here.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Far below us, the Cherokee traces the empty highway. There are no buildings, no houses, no other vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drives in silence. Amy stares out the window, bored. Looking for a distraction, she picks up a cellophane package of doughnuts and peruses the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to brighten the mood)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. Look at this. Says if you win this mail-in contest, you can choose either ninety thousand dollars or ninety thousand doughnuts. She gives him a playful glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do with ninety thousand doughnuts? Jeff shrugs, disinterested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... Sell 'em for thirty cents each and pay off this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what about ninety thousand dollars? What would you do with that? Jeff stares out the window.       He's not into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.    Look, Amy, I'm not -- Suddenly his eyes drop to the console between them -- JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!! My camera!        He stole my camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redneck at the gas station! He lifted it right under my nose! My brand new Nikon. (pounds wheel in frustration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go back?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the use. He's probably halfway to Bumblefuck now, the bastard. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, maybe if we call the cops -- Jeff is about to reply when suddenly the car bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? The car gives another jolt. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   I -- A warning light flashes on the instrument panel. The brakes and steering lose power. The engine quits cold. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on -- I can't steer! The CAR bucks and SCREECHES. After a few HICCUPS, it jerks to a halt, just beyond a crest in the road. For a moment, they sit there dazed, staring ahead at the empty road. Then Amy notices an object on the floor -- the Nikon. She picks it up. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Found your camera. He rolls his eyes.   He yanks the hood release and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam pours from under the    hood of the Cherokee. Amy gets out and looks around    at the scorched wasteland. Jeff goes to the front of    the car, gropes under the ho for the release latch. He     yanks his hand away, burned the hot metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Amy moves to Jeff to examine the burn.     She reaches ou JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) I said I'm fine, okay? Jeff lifts the hood, examines the engine. He tugs on a cable, checks the battery connection and radiator. He goes to the passenger's side and takes a hand-held cellular phone from the glove box. He dials zero and hits "send." The PHONE BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of range? Jeff grunts, tosses the phone on the seat. It bounces and lands on the floor. Amy watches as he returns to the engine and begins unscrewing the radiator cap. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Jeff? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it look like?      I'm trying to fix the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with you? Jeff busies himself with the engine, not answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a month since you got back. You can't keep shutting me out like this. Jeff says nothing. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I really don't want to go into this right now. I'm changing jobs, our finances are fucked, and we're stuck in the middle of nowhere. So could we maybe just fix the -- He stops in mid-sentence. There is a RUMBLE in the distance. They look down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, not these guys...

dialogues.speaker: DODGE RAM PICKUP
dialogues.text: approaching fast on the road. As it streaks past, Earl yells and launches a beer bottle from the window. The BOTTLE SHATTERS on the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: watching the Ram speed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down the road)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- A quarter-mile away, the pickup is slowing. It pulls a U-turn and stops, facing the Cherokee. It just sits there, ENGINE IDLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Jeff watches the pickup, frowning. Then, from the opposite direction, they hear a LOW RUMBLE. They turn and stare at --

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE TRACTOR-TRAILER
dialogues.text: coming over a crest in the road. It's a huge eighteen-wheeler. A white 1988 Peterbilt. It grinds into low gear and slows, BRAKES CREAKING. The TRUCK comes to a halt with a HISS of compressed air.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: the PICKUP STARTS UP again. It pulls another U-turn and drives away, melting into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: breathes a sigh of relief. The driver dismounts from the cab, leaving the ENGINE IDLING. We recognize him as the Trucker in the mini- mart. He removes his cap, revealing a shock of prematurely white hair. He is well-shaven, his clothes immaculate. His name is Red. RED (TRUCKER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You folks all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Our car broke down. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) I figured that much. You want a hand pushing it off the road? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I'd appreciate it.    Amy, you want to steer? Amy gets behind the wheel and puts the shift in neutral. Jeff and Red push the car to the shoulder. As they push, Jeff glances at the CB antenna on Red's cab. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you could radio a tow truck for us? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure would if I could, mister, but my C.B. blew a fuse this morning. I'm waiting till I hit the truck stop on I-40 to get it fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 60 miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Red walks around to the front of the car and peers down at the exposed engine. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd offer to take a look, but it's hard to say with these new engines. Used to be, you could give 'em a kick and a holler and they'd start right up. Now it's all computers and chips. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a new car. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be the problem. You been running it pretty fast? Amy gives Jeff a reprimanding look.     It's subtle, but notices. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what. If you want a ride, there's a little diner up the road. Belle's. They got a pay phone. You could call a tow truck from there. Jeff considers this, glances back to where the Dodge Ram was last seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice     of you to offer. But we've got a     lot of stuff in the car. I think     we're better off waiting for a cop     to come along. Amy rolls her eyes. Red sees the look, trying not to smile. He glances up at a small plane flying overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit    yourself. Not many cops on this    road, that's why the truckers use    it. Maybe you'll get lucky. (tipping his cap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good    luck. He turns and heads back toward his truck. Amy looks at Jeff. She waits till the trucker is out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know this guy. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's offering to help. It       could be hours before anyone else      comes along. It's 100 degrees.        You really want to be stuck out      here? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, I've got my equipment in the car. All our stuff. What if those guys come back and we're not here? (turns away, quietly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... don't be stupid... Amy hears this.       She's had enough.   Flares. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid is sitting out here waiting for a cop when we already have a ride. In the b.g., the TRUCK is THROTTLING UP.       Then, mad careless:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid was letting you talk me into leaving Boston. She turns away. The truck starts to pull out. She bites her lip, thinking, then steps into the road and flags the truck down. Red brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Do you think you could drop me at that diner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. How about you, mister? I could take you both just as easy. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. My husband wants to stay with the car. I'll just get my purse. She goes to the passenger side of the Jeep for her purse. Jeff follows, lowering his voice. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the diner. I'm going to call a tow truck. Then I'm going to order an iced tea and wait. Good-bye, Jeff. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) You're not riding with that guy. End of story. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to be alone. Well... you're alone. Why don't you take the time to get your head together? She walks to the truck. Jeff stands there. She climbs into the cab. Red moves some papers out of the way. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step, ma'am. She pulls the door shut. The TRUCK THROTTLES UP and pulls away. Jeff watches the truck dwindle in the distance, flashers blinking. After a beat, the flashers cease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath a blazing sun, Jeff paces restlessly in front of the Cherokee, checking his watch, wiping beads of sweat from his face. He looks down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nothing in sight. Extremely bored, he wanders over to the raised hood and studies the engine again. After a few moments, something catches his eye. Curious, he kneels down and peers under the chassis. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: LOOSE WIRE
dialogues.text: dangling under the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for Christ's sake... He pulls his Swiss Army knife  from his pocket and slides under the car. Working with   the screwdriver blade of th knife, he reconnects the plug  to its socket. In the process, his hands and shirt  become stained with grease. Jeff slides out from under the car, brushes himself off and gets behind the wheel. He tosses the Swiss Army knife on the center console and keys the ignition. The ENGINE ROARS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee speeds down the empty highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drives, a determined expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep blows past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weather-beaten structure with a gravel parking lot. peeling sign on the roof: "Belle's: Beer & Food." There is a phone booth outside. The Cherokee pulls in and parks.      Jeff CHIRPS the ALA heads for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and dingy. Formica tables, a bar. Chunky customers in K-Mart clothes sit at the bar, nursing beers and watching a football game on a big MUTED TV. Jeff enters and all conversation stops. The other patrons turn and stare. After a moment, they return to their beers. Jeff glances around.   No sign of Amy.   No sign of Red. A bored-looking BARTENDER stands behind the counter, preparing a sandwich. Behind him, a blackboard menu. Jeff approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The Bartender looks up, a cutting knife in his hand. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to meet my wife here. The Bartender shrugs, gives him a look:    Yeah, so? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark hair, slender, about five- five. Wearing a pale blue Benetton shirt. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale blue what? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benetton shirt. The Bartender plops the sandwich on a plate, tears off an order slip. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank!  Your order's ready. (to Jeff) I been busy. They come and go. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would've been within the last half hour. She might've been with a trucker? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy with a baseball cap.   Driving an eighteen wheeler. The Bartender thinks a moment, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? The Bartender leans over the counter, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Man here's looking for his wife, dark hair, button-on shirt, travelin' with a guy in a baseball cap. Anybody see 'em? Jeff looks up and down the counter. Blank faces, a few disinterested shrugs, a few headshakes no. A disheveled female barfly, FLO, grins up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like she got away from ya, cowboy. A few of the regulars chuckle at this.     Jeff ignores them, turns back to the Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could she have left a message with another one of your employees? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't see how. I'm the only one who works here. Jeff scratches his head.    This doesn't make any sense. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Is there another Belle's Diner? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) No siree. Definitely not. Jeff clenches his jaw, takes another look around.      An elderly couple sit at a rear table, watching him.      Th whisper to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He turns and goes outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff squints in the bright sunlight. Maybe he got this place confused with a different diner. He peers up at the sign. It says "Belle's," all right. He walks to the phone booth, looks inside.   The phone book is missing. He picks up the receiver, listens for the dial tone... Phone works okay. He hangs up. He stands there for a moment, scanning the horizon in all directions. There is nothing else out here, nowhere else she could have gone. Jeff marches back into the diner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff goes to the Bartender. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, how far is the next town? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twenty miles. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if my wife comes in -- her name is Amy -- tell her I was here. Tell her to stay put till I get back, not to move. Would you do that, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, bored)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Jeff regards the Bartender skeptically.    He takes one last look around, then heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff marches briskly to his car and opens the door, forgetting to deactivate the alarm. The SIREN WAILS. Jeff fumbles for the remote and shuts if OFF.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The Cherokee pulls out of the parking lot, kicking up gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stereo is off, the windows rolled up.   Jeff drives, his jaw set tightly. The speedometer reads 88 mph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee crests a rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then across the desert plain, traveling on another road, he sees it...

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: The 18-wheeler that picked up Amy.    Cruising leisurely. Jeff presses the accelerator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee turns sharply onto the other road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee speeds down the road, gaining on the Peterbilt. It comes up behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff HONKS his HORN, flashes his lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you fat-ass.    Pull over. Either the driver doesn't notice, or he's ignoring Jeff, but the truck does not slow down. Jeff shifts into the oncoming lane and pulls alongside the cab. He HONKS again and waves, gesturing for the truck to pull over. But the Peterbilt maintains its speed. Jeff cranes his neck to get a glimpse of the driver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Red, alright. But he's wearing a different cap. FROM this ANGLE, we can't see into the passenger side of the cab. Red peers down at Jeff, puzzled.      Jeff shouts at him, waves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over!    Pull over! Red suddenly notices something ahead in the road, BLARES his HORN. Jeff looks up, sees -- An RV camper approaching in the oncoming lane!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Jeff swerves onto the far shoulder as the RV whooshes past in the opposite direction, HORN BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: CHEROKEE
dialogues.text: Jeff is rattled, catching his breath.      He swings back onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Jeff slips in ahead of the Peterbilt, then starts weaving and braking, forcing the truck to slow.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Both vehicles pull to the side of the road and stop. Jeff leaps out of the Cherokee and runs over as Red climbs down from the empty cab. (NOTE: Throughout this scene, various cars and trucks pass in either direction.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, pal, what the hell you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was signaling you to stop. Didn't you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Jeff reacts.    How thick can this guy be? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife.     Where is she? Red gives him a puzzled look. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know where your wife is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked at the diner.      No one saw her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I don't know what you're talking about. Jeff stares -- is this guy nuts? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave her a ride. You were supposed to drop her at Belle's diner. Red searches his memory, trying to be as helpful as possible. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you not remember? It was just half an hour ago, for chrissakes! Red gives him a peculiar look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I never seen you before in my life. Suddenly, there is a loud SQUAWK from inside the cab -- the CB RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaker, breaker -- Iron Man, you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your radio works -- (locks eyes with Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing -- ? Jeff freaks out, circling the truck, calling loudly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy?    Amy?!   You in there? Red shrinks back, unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, mister, I don't know what you want, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my fucking wife, is what I want! What have you done to her?! Red's eyes dart to something in the distance.        Jeff catches this, turns...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF'S PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Cruising toward them. Jeff runs into the middle of the road and waves frantically. The patrol car switches on its flash bar and speeds up, pulling to a stop behind the Peterbilt.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHERIFF BOYD, 50ish, climbs out, sizing up the situation. Jeff runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, I need your help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, this guy has my wife! SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, sir. Tell me what's going on. Jeff catches his breath. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the hell's going on. Last time I saw her she was with this guy in his truck. Now he's saying he's never seen her! RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, he's crazy -- I don't know what he's talking about. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie, you son of a bitch! The Sheriff unsnaps the safety strap on his holster... just a precaution. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- everybody just calm down. (to Jeff) Sir, you want to tell me what happened? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our car broke down. This guy stopped to help us, said he'd drive my wife to a pay phone.    But she never showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Red)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, officer. I'm driving along, suddenly this fella runs me off the road and starts hollering about his wife. I swear, I never seen the guy before. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't give his wife a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying! The Sheriff takes a long look at both of them, unsure what to think. He turns back to Red. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, all right with you if I search your truck? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes, officer. Go right ahead. Name's Red, by the way. Red Barr. (pulls out his wallet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My permits are all current. You can check 'em out. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary yet. Just stand back behind the line. Both of you. As Red closes his wallet, several credit cards fall to the ground. He bends to scoop them up. Jeff eyes this suspiciously. The Sheriff climbs up into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff pokes his head inside, looks around. Pretty much what you'd expect in a long-haul big rig: a CB radio, a plastic Jesus, a map of the U.S. taped to the ceiling with hundreds of magic marker X's showing where the truck has been.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks into the sleeping area behind. A blanket is folded over a foam mattress. A stained pillow rests on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Red keep a careful eye on each other as the Sheriff climbs down from the cab, wiping his hands. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to both of them) All right, let's see your license and registration. Jeff and Red fish into their wallets and hand over I.D.'s. The Sheriff examines them, comparing faces to pictures and writing down names. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you hauling today, Mr. Barr? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, empty load. I'm heading to Fresno for a pick up -- ball bearings or something. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing him) Long way to go empty. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. Too much competition nowadays. One horse guys like me gotta drive halfway 'cross the country just to get a payin' job. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff, impatient) Are we gonna keep looking or what? The Sheriff hands back the I.D.'s. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are. (to Red) Sir, I'm gonna have to see everything. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.   I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and the Sheriff observe as Red unlatches two heavy padlocks. Grunting, he raises the slatted METAL DOOR. It retracts along the ceiling with a noisy RATTLE.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The cavernous interior is mostly empty, except for a few randomly strewn cardboard boxes, too small to contain a person. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: boxes) Those yours? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Personal stuff. Clothes and whatnot. You want to take a look? The Sheriff considers it, shakes his head. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think we're pretty much done here. You're free to go. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) Whoa, whoa -- wait a sec. That's it? You're not going to question him anymore? SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I searched the truck. There's no evidence of suspicious activity, no sign of struggle. Red has been looking on.   He chimes in, trying to be helpful: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to butt in, but maybe you got my truck confused with someone else's. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lunges) Go to hell, you sonofabitch -- The Sheriff grabs Jeff, holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! You want to get arrested? Now the man has a point. This is a plain-looking, John Doe truck. Maybe you did get them mixed up. Jeff stares at the Sheriff a beat, then bolts suddenly for the front of the truck. He yanks open the door and leaps up into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! The Sheriff jogs after him.      Red walks to the cab, unconcerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff searches the cab for signs of Amy. He tosses aside a jacket, rifles papers on the floor. There is nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Boyd looks up sternly as Jeff continues searching the cab. Red watches calmly. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taylor, either you come down from there or I'm going to have to arrest you. Jeff gives up reluctantly. He looks lame and desperate and he knows it. He steps down from the cab, gritting his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him.    It was this truck. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, I can see that. Did you get a license plate? Jeff stares at him, knows where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the information on the door panel. You recall any of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't paying attention. The Sheriff studies him a beat, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taylor, did you by any chance have a beef with your wife today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for starters, maybe she left you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this... SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it a hundred times. Lovers, married couples, gay guys. You put two people in a car long enough, they'll go at it. Hell, I've even seen men dump their women on the side of the road, and vice versa. Jeff stares at the cop.    Emphatic: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife did not leave me. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in) Officer, I'm sorry, I'd like to stay and help, but I really got to make it to Fresno... SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Go ahead, sir.         I appreciate your cooperation. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane. You're just going to let him go? SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got his information. If we need to find him later, we'll know where to look.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much obliged. (to Jeff) Good luck findin' your wife, mister. No hard feelings. Red climbs into the cab. Jeff watches helplessly, resigned to the fact there's nothing more he can do. Sheriff goes to the cruiser and speaks on the radio. the truck drives off, Jeff goes over to the cruiser. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I believe you that your wife is missing. Maybe you got confused about what truck she got into, maybe you had a fight -- you don't have to tell me. The point is I'm trying to help. He hands Jeff a card with an address printed on it. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town of Brackett's 31 miles that way. My deputy's name is Len Carver. He's a good man. He'll help you fill out the necessary forms if you want to report your wife missing. Jeff clenches his jaw as the words sink in.    The Sherif softens, his tone sympathetic. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want my opinion, your wife is probably around here. Lost or plenty pissed off and giving you a scare. Either way, she'll turn up. As Jeff stares at the Sheriff, the police RADIO SQUAWKS. DISPATCHER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Sheriff, this is dispatch. Mrs. Gilbert's locked out of her trailer again. Can you respond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10-4, dispatch. Tell her I'm on my way. He racks the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your name and badge number. The Sheriff looks up at Jeff, sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Arthur Boyd. 226-93. This really isn't necessary -- JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what's necessary, goddamnit. I'm noting the exact time of this conversation. 10:52 A.M. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Suit yourself, Mr. Taylor. The Sheriff shifts into gear and drives away. Jeff is left standing on the side of the road, desert in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall is covered with missing persons' notices. Photographs of men, women and children stare back at us. Names and dates are printed across the bottom of the notices. PULL BACK to reveal Jeff staring at the gallery of faces. It's a creepy feeling. Several yards away, DEPUTY LEN CARVER, a young puffy-faced lawman, sits at a desk filling out a form. Jeff looks shaken. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a recent picture? Jeff glances over. Deputy Carver is holding up a wallet- sized photograph of Amy. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months old. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still wear her hair like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Deputy resumes filling out the form.   He clicks his tongue sympathetically. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll certainly do our best, Mr. Taylor. There's over a hundred thousand people go missing in this country every year. Runaways, deadbeat dads, dropouts, folks hiding from the I.R.S. -- all vanishing without a trace. Jeff stares at the faces. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm not saying she's one of them. I sure hope not. But unless there's a ransom demand or evidence of forced abduction, believe me, the F.B.I. won't even look at your case till it's been 24 hours. Deputy Carver finishes the paperwork and staples the photograph to the form. He looks up at Jeff. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, we'll sure keep our eyes peeled. How's that sound? Jeff clenches his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this high vantage point, we see Jeff's car approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherokee pulls up to the side of the building.   Jeff gets out and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff enters, looks around. It's the same scene as before: same Bartender, a slightly different cast of characters. No sign of Amy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff advances to the Bartender, who stands at a sink rinsing beer mugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up, uninterested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't see her. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't see her, or she didn't come in? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, I told you the last time. I'm busy. Maybe she came in, maybe she didn't. All I know is, I didn't see her. Jeff looks around, not particularly trusting the Bartender's skills of observation. He grinds his jaw. The other customers at the bar have been watching all this. One of them, an older grizzled BARFLY, looks up at Jeff. BARFLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially) None of my business, mister. But if I was you I'd take a look in the ladies room. The Barfly gives Jeff a wink and turns back to his beer. Snickers from some of his bar mates, who avert their eyes when Jeff glances at them. Jeff knows this is almost certainly a put-on, but he can't take a chance. While the Barflies watch, poker-faced, Jeff walks to the door of the ladies room, hesitates, then knocks. His knock is answered by a wordless sound, HALF-GROAN, HALF- GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy? Silence. Jeff tries the door. It's locked. He rattles it. Another GROAN. Jeff puts his shoulder against the door, heaves inward. The door swings open, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Flo, bent over the toilet, vomiting. She whirls around, a strand of spittle dangling from her lip. FLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- what the hell you doing?! Jeff backs away, yanks the door shut.   The barflies chuckle among themselves. Jeff strides angrily for the exit. He stops at the door, takes one last look around. No one seems to be paying him much attention. He turns to leave... ... but something stops him. He can't put his finger on it. There's something wrong here... He stares at the other customers. Why do they avoid eye contact? Are they hiding something? He scrutinizes more closely... There is the gruff trucker, sitting at a nearby table shoveling food in his mouth. He's been averting his gaze ever since Jeff walked in. And then there's the traveling salesman. Overweight, sweaty. Popping vitamins along with his coffee. Or what about the shirtless biker, reading a comic book at the bar? Probably an ex-con. While Jeff is running these suspicions through his mind, a trucker approaches the counter to place an order. The Bartender jots it down on a pad, then tears off the carbon slip. He places one copy above the grill and another in a pile by the cash register. Jeff stares, an idea forming... He approaches the bar. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see your order slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You write down the names.   I want to see them. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, nuts? I don't have to show you jack shit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff leans in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my wife came in here, then her name's in that pile. The Bartender stiffens, stares him straight in the eye: BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You calling me a liar? A tense beat. Possessed by a sudden impulse, Jeff makes a grab for the receipts. Before he can reach them, the Bartender's hand clamps onto his. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I've had just about enough of you. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see the fucking slips. In one swift motion, Jeff overpowers the man and extracts the receipts. He starts going through them, fast, looking at names. TULLY, MARK, FLO, ANDY and... Jeff raises his eyes to face the unpleasant end of a Smith & Wesson revolver. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, mister, you're going to have to leave. Jeff takes a step back. Everyone in the diner is staring. He stumbles backwards, heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff exits, breathing hard, and runs to the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: is occupied by a YOUNG MAN with an awkward oversized frame, ill-fitting clothes. Jeff raps on the glass anxiously. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I need the phone -- I have to call the police!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Man looks up, dull and glassy-eyed. His sluggish demeanor suggests mental retardation. He hangs up and slowly opens the door. SLUGGISH MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawls) My name's Billy. You the feller lookin' for his wife? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know? Did you see her? The Sluggish Man hesitates. There's something holding him back. Jeff senses this. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, if you know something, anything, tell me. BILLY (SLUGGISH MAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) I seen her... maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    When? Billy is about to answer. In b.g., the Bartender sticks his head out of the diner. Billy backs away, spooked. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. Never shoulda opened my damn mouth. Now I'm gonna git it. Billy breaks into a loping run through the parking lot. Jeff hurries after him and catches up, cornering Billy between two cars, trying to calm him. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's going to hurt you, Billy. Just tell me what you saw. Billy glances around nervously, swallowing. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came in on a truck.   A big white one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she... she got in another truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another truck? With who? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. Some men. Bad men. They say I'm a dummy, but I ain't. I see things. Jeff reels, struggles to stay focused. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where they went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.    Route seven.   Up by the river. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where by the river?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. They don't tell me that kind of stuff. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't? The bartender?      The men in the truck? Billy's expression darkens.     He starts backing away. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't talking to you no more. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, I need you to come to the police. If you tell them what you saw, they'll be able to help me. Billy laughs. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're the dummy. Jeff looks at him, confused. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you git it? The police is the ones in on it! Billy turns and runs back into the diner.       ON Jeff's sickened reaction, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drives flat-out, his face grim.    The speedometer reads 100 mph. Keeping his eye on the road, he thumbs through the pages of a pocket address book. He picks up the handheld cellular phone and dials. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... work, goddammit... The "NO SERVICE" INDICATOR BEEPS. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The highway intersects Route 7. The Cherokee slows just enough to take the corner without tipping over. It flies past a sign:   "Route 7 - North."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road ascends into the rocky hills above the desert plain. The route is narrow and windy, forcing Jeff to reduce his speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drives, desperately searching for any sign of a truck. There are no other vehicles on the road. He keeps pressing the "REDIAL" button.    The "NO SERVICE INDICATOR BEEPS over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road curves through a tunnel, then climbs higher, past sharp cliffs and drop-offs. Jeff follows the signs for "Route 7."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Jeff's eye on the cell phone. For the first time, the "SERVICE" indicator blinks green. Jeff immediately grabs the phone again and presses "REDIAL."

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is a burst of STATIC, then we hear a SCRATCHY RINGING. The call is going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thank God)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He waits for an answer. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Steve? It's Jeff Taylor... Listen, I -- don't put me on hold! I need a favor... I've gotta talk to that friend of yours at the F.B.I... No, it's about Amy, she's missing -- There is a burst of STATIC.       The reception is very p JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said Amy's been -- More STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Jeff holds the phone tight to his ear. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm still here.       No -- don't call back -- Steve?!       Steve?! The SIGNAL CUTS OFF.    Jeff slams the phone against the dash, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! He punches redial, gets the "NO SERVICE" BEEPING, then glances up, sees a --

dialogues.speaker: CHAINLINK FENCE
dialogues.text: covered with high-visibility markers stretched across the road. The sign: "ROAD CLOSED."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: He mashes the brakes. The CHEROKEE SKIDS to a halt just short of the fence. Jeff stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He grinds his teeth. Beyond the padlocked gate, the highway continues as an unpaved dirt road. He deliberates, then throws the Cherokee in reverse and does a three-point turn so he's facing back in the opposite direction. He looks up, sees --

dialogues.speaker: DODGE RAM PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: has been hiding in the bushes off the road. It lurches forward and stops in the middle of the road, blocking Jeff's escape. Jeff's eyes widen in fear as he recognizes the vehicle and its driver: Earl. Earl gets out of the cab with a hunting rifle.   He raise it to his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the car! Put your hands where I can see 'em!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: swears, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get out, dammit!   Now! Jeff stares into the rifle, deliberating.   His hand move to the gearshift. He jerks it into reverse and floors the gas!

dialogues.speaker: CHEROKEE
dialogues.text: peels out in reverse, snaking wildly side to side, aiming for the chainlink fence. It BURSTS the FENCE!   Poles and chain mesh go flying!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: cranks the wheel and brakes hard. The rear end of the Cherokee swings wide to the edge of the road. He throws the shift into drive and punches the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: jumps in the Ram and takes off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: GUNS the ENGINE. The Cherokee bounces wildly on the rutted, storm-damaged road. He yanks the four-wheel- drive lever.

dialogues.speaker: DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: The huge pickup streaks after the Cherokee, its 7.5-LITER V10 ROARING, oversized tires devouring the terrain.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: GUNS the ENGINE on the washboard road surface, the vibration nearly shaking the suspension apart while --

dialogues.speaker: RAM
dialogues.text: keeps pace in the dust from its wake. Inside the cab, Earl can be seen speaking on a CB transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: throws the Cherokee into a sharp turn in the road. As the car rounds the bend, he looks up, reacting, as --

dialogues.speaker: IDLED BULLDOZER
dialogues.text: blocks the road at a construction site. More unattended earthmoving equipment fills the road beyond.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: brakes wildly. To his right, a cliff goes straight up; on the left, a guardrail protects a steep ravine. He cuts the wheel left, CRASHES through the GUARDRAIL and plunges into the ravine!

dialogues.speaker: CHEROKEE
dialogues.text: bounces wildly as it hurtles down the slope, CRASHING through sagebrush and manzanita.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: clings to the wheel, tossed about violently, as suitcases and packing boxes go everywhere. The Cherokee hits a bump on the steep slope and CRASHES through the upper branches of a willow grove. As the leaves part, we see... a river.

dialogues.speaker: CHEROKEE
dialogues.text: lands on the passenger side with a SPLASH and comes to rest half-submerged in the RUSHING WATER.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: jerks the Ram to a halt, leaps out and runs to the edge of the road to look down on the Cherokee in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch... He grabs the rifle and begins making his way down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CHEROKEE
dialogues.text: The world is sideways. Water rushes into the car. Jeff is strapped into the driver's seat by the seatbelt. The AIRBAG DEFLATES with a HISS. Jeff grimaces in pain. He looks around, blinking.   The river is flowing right through the Cherokee! Luggage, styrofoam hamburger clamshells and empty Coke cans bob on the surface of the water. Jeff fumbles with the seatbelt release. The belt comes free and he drops suddenly into the water on the passenger side. He gets to his feet, reaches overhead to unlatch the driver's side door and pushes it open. He hoists himself through the door.

dialogues.speaker: RIVERBANK
dialogues.text: Earl sees Jeff emerging from the half-submerged Cherokee, levels the RIFLE and FIRES!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: ducks back inside the Cherokee, freaking. The passenger side is on the river-bottom and if he tries to get out through the driver's side, he's a sitting duck! Jeff swears and looks around, seeing a metal camera case underwater in the back seat. He grabs the case and swings it at the windshield.   The first three blows bounce off harmlessly. Then the WINDSHIELD SHATTERS with a CRASH! He takes a deep breath, submerges and swims underwater through the broken windshield.

dialogues.speaker: ON BANK
dialogues.text: Earl stiffens as he sees movement in the water. Several items of debris from the car are floating on the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! He begins moving downstream along the bank, eyeing the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff breaststrokes for all he's worth. Sand swirls in the swift current. He pushes away from a boulder in his path. He swims until his lungs are bursting, then surfaces for air.

dialogues.speaker: ON BANK
dialogues.text: Earl sees Jeff break the surface. He aims the RIFLE and FIRES! A BULLET SMACKS the WATER near Jeff's head. Then Jeff is under again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff struggles to stay in control. The current is turning swifter. His shoulder glances painfully off a boulder.

dialogues.speaker: ON BANK
dialogues.text: Earl works his way through the brush at the river's edge. His foot lands between two rocks. He pulls it out, swearing.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND ROCK
dialogues.text: Jeff surfaces and gulps in air, staying out of sight of Earl on the bank. Then he is down again.

dialogues.speaker: ON BANK
dialogues.text: Earl works his way along the shore. Up ahead, the river runs over rapids before passing around a bend. Earl hears an ENGINE and turns. A huge moving van has arrived on the dirt road overlooking the ravine. He shouts to the DRIVER, pointing downriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting away! The Driver shouts something inaudible. Earl runs along the bank, ducking under low-hanging branches.

dialogues.speaker: IN RAPIDS
dialogues.text: Jeff is carried over the rocks by the fast-moving current. He slams into a boulder, letting out a cry and swallowing a mouthful of water. A downed tree hangs over the river. Jeff grabs desperately and takes hold of a branch. He's got it! Hanging on to the branch, he notices a familiar object floating past in the water: the "90,000 Donuts" pack. Jeff tries to haul himself from the river. The BRANCH bends under his weight. Then it comes free with a CRACK! Jeff is carried downstream on the rushing water.

dialogues.speaker: ON BANK
dialogues.text: Earl works his way along the shore.    The unseen Driver the van shouts to him from upriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the water!   I just saw him!

dialogues.speaker: BELOW RAPIDS
dialogues.text: The river has turned slow again. Jeff fights to his feet in the shallows and staggers to the bank. He drops to his knees, retching. Clutching his ribs, he raises his head and looks upriver. For the moment, there is no sign of Earl. But he could appear anytime. Jeff gets to his feet, wincing. He looks up at the rocky canyon wall bordering the river. It's steep but scalable. He begins climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff has climbed to higher ground. He lies flat on his belly and peers THROUGH a gap in the rocks at the river valley below.

dialogues.speaker: RIVER
dialogues.text: The men have given up their pursuit. The moving van, a jumbo three-axle GMC, has turned around and backed up to the edge of the ravine. A stocky man, AL (whom we recognize as Earl's passenger at the minimart), operates a gas-powered winch in the cargo door of the van. A cable runs from the winch down to the Cherokee in the river. Standing knee-deep in the current, Earl signals to Al while the winch slowly tugs the Cherokee onto its wheels, then backwards out of the river.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: watching in amazement.   He can hear only snatches of their conversation. AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... can't believe you let him get away... EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try chasing... through this shit... AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... this is what happens when you get one without the other... Jeff can't believe it. The Cherokee is being pulled backwards up the slope toward the road. He belly-crawls back from the outcropping, gets to his feet and climbs higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff has moved to higher ground. He crouches behind a stand of manzanita and looks down at the activity below.

dialogues.speaker: ROAD
dialogues.text: The Cherokee is now back on the road. Operating the winch with precision efficiency, Earl and Al drag the Cherokee up a ramp into the rear of the moving van. Once the vehicle is aboard, they stow the ramp and close the van doors.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: watching in amazement, straining to hear what Earl and Al are saying. Behind Jeff, a PEBBLE SKITTERS on the rock. He turns, reacts. It's Billy -- the halfwit from the diner! Wielding a shotgun like a club, he swings the butt at Jeff's skull! Jeff drops to the ground, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a CREAK as the TRUNK opens. Jeff lies inside, dazed and disoriented, blinking into the sun. His eyes won't focus. Earl and Billy stand over the trunk in silhouette. He can hear their voices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He coming around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be... I clocked him pretty good... A gun barrel jabs Jeff in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and shine, dad. Jeff blinks. A face slowly comes INTO FOCUS. Is it really Billy? The halfwit from the diner? Only he isn't a halfwit anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, shake a leg. Jeff looks at Billy. Nothing makes sense anymore. But one thing is clear: Billy's mental retardation was all an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us some answers and you might find out. According to her, you've got a pretty good pile of ready cash sitting in the bank. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... well, 'some' doesn't cut it. Your wife gave us a dollar figure. I want the same exact from you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming around; stalling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- there's different accounts... the balance fluctuates... BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluctuates, my ass. If a hotshot like you ain't tracking his bottom line, it'd be the first time in history. (turning) What do you think, Earl? EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been fucked with, is what I think. Little slut lied to us. Put 'em on the spot, they'll say anything to stay alive. Billy nods, disappointed. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I suppose. Too bad. (peers down at Jeff) Guess you're not the donut magnate after all. (to Earl) Waste of time. Plug him. Earl raises a pistol.   Jeff's eyes flash. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting out) Ninety thousand. Earl stops, glances at Billy.   They both eye Jeff carefully. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) Ninety thousand dollars. A faint smile plays on Billy's lips.     He slams the tru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nearly pitch black. A beam of sunlight shines through a rusted hole. It illuminates Jeff's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The car shifts into gear and sets off across the desert. Jeff grunts as the car bounces on the uneven terrain. He braces against the confines of the trunk. The ENGINE NOISE is deafening. The car hits a depression and jounces wildly. Jeff is thrown about violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a CREAK and the TRUNK opens. Jeff squints into the sun. Earl and Billy stand over the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.   Don't try anything stupid. Jeff gets out, grimacing.     His clothes are stained wit grease and tire grime. He     sets his feet unsteadily on the ground, looks around.     We see that he has been confined in the trunk of a    Pontiac Firebird. The Firebird and Dodge Ram are parked on a bluff. Red stands on the highest point, peering through binoculars at the desert below. He glances at Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a tough man to get a hold of, Jeffrey. Jeff stares, a mix of emotions -- anger, fear, confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to control himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me we're talking about. Question is what you want. Jeff looks at him with loathing. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I've got something you might want to buy. Can't show you the merchandise right now, but I can describe it for you. About five- five, hundred and fifteen pounds. I'd say three, maybe four of that is tits. Black curly hair upstairs and down. Interested?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff's anger bubbles over... JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch -- He advances toward Red. Billy and Earl grab him from behind and tackle him to the ground. Billy drives a fist into his kidney. Jeff gasps in pain. Red nods impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him up here. Earl and Billy hoist Jeff to his feet and propel him up the mound closer to Red. From here, Jeff can see a small desert town spread out below, as well as the highway leading through it. Red gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Brackett, Jeff. If ever there was a two-bit shithole in the middle of nowhere, this is it. One gas station, a half-dozen stores and a V.F.W. hall. (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that building? Jeff follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the bank. Brackett Commerce Bank. You with me? Jeff nods tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
