dialogues.text: Then here's the drill. You're gonna walk in there and tell the manager you want an express wire in the amount of $90,000 from your account in Boston. Got your wallet? Jeff nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask for the money in cash. Small bills.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's payday at the copper mine, so don't take any horsecock about how they haven't got it. If the manager gives you a hard time, that's your problem. It's your wife who's counting on you. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know she's still alive? Billy slugs him in the gut again.   Jeff doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tucked away someplace safe. You get her back as soon as we get the money. Simple as that. Jeff compresses his lips. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a smart guy like you, you're already thinking about calling the cops, right? Jeff says nothing. Red raises a hand-held CB to his mouth. He keys the transmitter. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Iron Man to Blacktop, let's open the gate. AL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Copy that, Iron Man. Red turns back to Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, Jeff, if you want to call the cops, there's nothing I can do. Hell, with the fire you've got in your eyes right now, I figure you're fixing on calling the F.B.I., C.I.A. -- even the 82nd Airborne. Jeff stares back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem is, you can see this town for miles around. So ask yourself: How's the law gonna get here? They gonna fly in? Drive in? Either way, we'll see 'em. So let me be very clear: if we see one unmarked car, one plane, one human being who even smells like a cop -- this deal is dead. He tosses Jeff the binoculars. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take a look at the building with the flagpole. Jeff hesitates, then raises the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The IMAGE SHIFTS, then STEADIES and FOCUSES ON a small building with a police cruiser out front and a barely legible sign: "BRACKETT SHERIFF." It's the police station where Jeff filed the missing persons' form earlier. RED (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's exactly two cops in this town. One of them's inside pulling ass duty; the other's on patrol in the foothills. Now a minute ago one of my men called in a non-injury accident on the I-40 connector. Deputy Carver comes out of the building gulping down a sandwich. He gets in the cruiser and pulls away, lights flashing. RED (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take that good ol' boy 20 minutes to get to the connector, another 10 to see there's no accident, and another 20 or so to tool his way back. 50 minutes all in. The cruiser pulls away down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: lowers the binoculars and looks at Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your deadline. If for any reason one of those cops pulls into town before I'm looking at a bag of money, your wife is dead, you're shit out of luck and we're gone for good. He smiles at Jeff. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's why there's no risk to us in this thing. You do the legwork. We sit back, we watch, we listen to our scanners, we monitor you every step of the way. If at any moment we don't like something, we split. Period. (beat) Helluva lot safer than sticking up 7-11s, wouldn't you say? They lock eyes.   Red tosses Jeff a Windbreaker. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on. You can't go into the bank like that. Jeff puts on the jacket.    It covers his filthy shirt. Red checks his watch. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Jeff? Time to get the show on the road? ON Jeff's expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff stumbles and nearly falls as he descends   the loose rock at the foot of the mesa. He looks up at    the ridge but Red and his crew have pulled back out of   view. Jeff starts across an open field toward the town,   first jogging, then running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hurries toward the bank. He looks back at the mesa again. The gang has disappeared. Up ahead, a mud-streaked pickup cruises the main street. Jeff eyes it warily. Is it one of theirs? The truck pulls around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff pushes through the main doors. It's a typical small town operation. A guard stands near the entrance. Several customers wait in line for the woman teller. Jeff looks at the slow-moving line and swears softly. He doesn't have time to wait. He glances around, sees an older man sitting at a desk in the rear of the bank, the nameplate on the desk identifying him as Roger Calhoun. Jeff approaches. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see the manager. I need a wire transfer from my bank in Boston. CALHOUN looks up from his paperwork, hesitates at Jeff's appearance. CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... sir. I'm the manager. Would you like to have a seat? Jeff remains standing.    He eyes the other customers nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning; preoccupied)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you can have a seat if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. He takes a seat across the desk from the manager, reaches into his wallet and brings out several forms of identification.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my driver's license, credit card if you need it, my account number in Boston... How long is this going to take? Calhoun looks at him curiously. CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Yes, I'm fine. Look, that account only has $5,000 in it. How much can you advance me on my credit card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) My credit card. I've got a $6,000 limit. Can you advance me the whole $6,000? Calhoun looks mystified. CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't. For non-customers the limit is $500 a day. Sir, are you sure you're all right? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm fine. Just... transfer the money, okay? Calhoun raises an eyebrow and begins filling out the transfer form. Jeff eyes him, decides he has to risk it. He leans toward the desk. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm going to tell you something. Whatever happens, just keep filling out that form, okay? CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up; baffled) Sir? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people watching --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you the manager? Jeff turns. A GUY wearing cowboy boots and a feed cap stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady over there said to see you about a car loan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating waiting area)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir. Would you like to have a seat? The guy takes a seat ten feet away. Jeff looks at him, paranoid. Their eyes meet. Jeff looks away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to Jeff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying, Mr. Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... transfer the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff enters and locks the door. He startles at his reflection in the mirror.     He is sunburned, dirty, lacerated. He opens a cabinet and rifles through the supplies, looking for anything that could be used as a weapon. tosses aside detergents and air fresheners. He picks up   the toilet plunger, pulls the wooden rod fr the rubber   base. He swings it into his palm a few times testing it   as a club. It's too bulky. He won't be able to conceal   it. He checks his watch. Time is running out.      He takes o last look around the bathroom, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff comes out of the rest room. The manager is behind the teller's counter. The cowboy is gone. In his place sits a middle-aged blue collar worker. He looks at Jeff. Jeff takes a seat, glances at Calhoun's empty desk. There is a letter opener on the desk, several paper bands for wrapping currency. Positioning his body so no one can see, Jeff takes the letter opener and slips it into his sleeve. He scoops up a handful of currency wrappers. Jeff goes to the teller's window, scribbles something on the back of a deposit slip and hands it to the teller. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell the manager I want the money in these denominations? The teller looks at him oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff comes out of the bank with a manila envelope, glancing up and down the street. There's no sign of the men. He squints toward the mesa. No sign of them there either. He stands there. What's he supposed to do now? He checks his watch, growing anxious. Finally he is about to jog back in the direction he came, when... a PHONE RINGS. Jeff turns. There's a pay PHONE down the street. It RINGS again. He approaches quickly, lifts the receiver. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. RED (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) No shit. I can SEE that.   How much you got? Jeff looks up and down the street, trying to figure out where they're watching from. He looks toward the bank, glimpses the manager peering through the window. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole thing. Ninety thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Turn left and start walking toward the main road. Get in the first car that stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I see my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I say so. Now walk. The LINE CLICKS.    Jeff hangs up and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calhoun speaks on the phone. CALHOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie, this is Roger Calhoun down at the bank. Is the Sheriff there? (a beat) Well, maybe it's nothing, but you might tell him we just had a fellow in here acting kind of strange...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks along the road, carrying the envelope. Various cars pass in either direction, but none slow down. Jeff stiffens as an 18-wheeler approaches. But the TRUCK THUNDERS past, blowing a cloud of dust and sand in his face. Jeff continues walking, anxiously checking over his shoulder every few moments. His eyes narrow. The Dodge Ram pickup is cruising toward him. It slows, then brakes to a halt. The passenger door opens. Earl sits behind the wheel, aiming an automatic pistol. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss the envelope on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   First you tell me where she is. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, asshole. First you give me the money, then you find out. Unless you want me to shoot you dead right here on the highway. Jeff looks around, wonders if Earl would risk shooting him in view of passing traffic. Jeff hesitates, then tosses the envelope on the      seat Earl opens it, reaches in and pulls out several      pack of currency. They are wrapped with paper bands       and appear to be stacks of fifties and hundreds. He       rep them and gestures at Jeff with the gun. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now lift your shirt and jacket and turn around. Jeff complies. Earl sees that he isn't carrying a gun. He beckons Jeff toward the truck with the automatic. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, hands behind your back, and step toward the truck. Jeff takes two backwards steps toward the passenger side door. Earl grabs his arms, yanks roughly and wraps them with several layers of duct tape. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get up in the truck, knees on the floor. Do it now! Jeff struggles into an awkward kneeling position on the floor, facing the rear of the pickup, his belly pressed against the seat. Earl reaches over and pulls the door shut. He throws the truck in gear and starts driving. Jeff grimaces, looking up at him. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you the money.     Now let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Let her go.'    Do I look like I have her? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell -- Earl backhands Jeff against the passenger door. There is a RINGING sound and Earl pulls a CELL PHONE from his pocket. He presses a button and raises it to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. I'm heading in. (a beat; listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. He ends the call and tosses the cell phone on the dash. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be the dumbest motherfuck yet. You think we picked you out of the blue? New car, Massachusetts plates -- probably be days before anyone misses you. Hell, you shoulda got the bumper sticker that goes with it: 'Rich Assholes Looking for Trouble!' He tucks the pistol in his belt.   Jeff looks at him, seething. Jeff tries to squirm free. Earl sees it and belts him across the temple. Jeff slams into the passenger door, wincing. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have loved to see the look on your face when that car seized up. (mimicking panicked driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help, help, I ain't got no power! Earl laughs. Jeff has come to rest with his back against the door. By contorting his arms, he is able to draw the letter opener from his pocket. He manipulates the letter opener into position and begins cutting the duct tape that binds his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Steering with one hand, Earl reaches into the envelope, pulls out a packet of bills and waves it in Jeff's face. Jeff saws faster at the duct tape. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm gonna do first with your money, boy? Well, do you? Jeff glares at him. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fluttering bills under his nose) I'll give you a hint. Only one thing smells better than money. You wanta guess what? Earl laughs obscenely. He riffles the bills under his nose again, then stops abruptly, frowning. He looks down at the bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Earl stares at the bills. Jeff works feverishly behind his back. Earl pulls out another packet, then another, examining the bills. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are... it's nothing but singles... (erupting) You lyin' sonofabitch! There is a RIPPING SOUND. Jeff wrests his hands free and lunges across the cab. He plants the letter opener in Earl's shoulder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaagghh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup veers across the center line on the narrow mountain road. It swerves back, over-correcting wildly, and drifts for the opposite shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff seizes the pistol from Earl's waistband.    Earl flails and knocks the pistol from his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The pistol flies onto the floor. Earl uncorks a vicious backhand. Jeff's head snaps sideways. He grabs Earl by the arm and twists sharply. Earl howls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup careens back and forth across the treacherous roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff gropes on the floor. His hand closes around the pistol and he swings it at Earl -- crack! Earl's nose erupts! Jeff reaches across and jams his foot on the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PICKUP SCREECHES and comes to a halt straddling the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff swings the pistol into Earl's face -- crack! Earl tries to fend off the blows. Jeff creams him again -- crack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOW TRUCK DRIVER traveling in the opposite direction pulls to a stop. He gawks at the two men struggling in the pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff aims the pistol at point blank range.     Earl is a bloody wreck. His head lolls groggily. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, goddammit?   What'd you do with her? Earl sneers. Jeff is about to slug him again when he notices the two truck parked across the road, the driver staring out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff swears and wrestles Earl into the passenger seat. He seizes the roll of duct tape and binds Earl's wrists, then passes the tape under his legs so Earl is effectively hog-tied. He then slams Earl back in the seat, circles his neck twice with tape and wraps the free end around the base of the passenger side headrest. Earl begins to gasp for air. The Tow Truck Driver gets out and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   You there! Jeff gets behind the wheel and throws the pickup into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Two Truck Driver leaps out of the way as the pickup surges forward, tires smoking. He stares open-mouthed after the departing vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drives, one hand on the wheel, the other brandishing the pistol at Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to breathe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Jeff swings the pistol. There is a crack of exploding teeth! Earl's mouth erupts with frothy blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that?     How about this? Jeff hits the brakes. Earl is thrown forward, letting out a strangled cry as the duct tape chokes off his windpipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four wheel anti-lock brakes, you sonofabitch! You want to try 'em again?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hits the brakes again, harder.       Earl's tongue protrudes from his lips, choking.       His face is red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about an emergency stop? You want to try that, Earl? Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you don't! He slams the brakes again. Earl's eyes bulge sickeningly. He is being choked to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you want? You really want me to stop? 'Cause I bet this baby stops on a dime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling in the opposite direction, Sheriff Boyd is returning toward town. As he rounds a bend in the road, he sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ram driving erratically and weaving back and forth across the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Ram passes, Sheriff Boyd throws the cruiser into a SCREECHING 180-degree turn. He flicks on the SIREN and takes off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff glances in the rearview mirror. The cruiser is on their tail, SIREN WAILING, lights flashing. He swears and pumps the brakes in a series of rapid bursts. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the line, Earl! How about it? You gonna tell me? EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?     Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!    Driving around! Jeff hits the brakes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Boyd jerks the wheel to avoid a collision with the pickup as it slows and accelerates in rapid spurts. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Repeat, I am in pursuit of a Dodge Ram pickup. Request back-up, repeat, request back-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser pulls up alongside the pickup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd reacts in amazement to what he sees -- SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ -- (on radio) Dispatch! Suspect identified as one Jeffrey Taylor, repeat, Jeffrey Taylor! Boyd taps his brakes, falling back behind the pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you taking the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the truck stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main highway... Texaco... Jeff has the information he needs.       He slams on the brakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Boyd swerves to avoid a crash as the RAM SCREECHES to a halt in front of him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser skids to a stop. Jeff leaps from the pickup with the pistol in his hand. He rushes toward the cruiser. Sheriff Boyd hops out, levels his service revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where she is!   My wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun! Jeff pitches the gun away and it skitters down an embankment. He raises his hands. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand!      She's been kidnapped! SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand plenty. Now get down on the ground or I'll shoot! He means it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl struggles for breath. The duct tape is still tight around his neck. He strains against the tape binding his limbs. He glances in the side view mirror to see the Sheriff ordering Jeff down on the ground. By wriggling and contorting his wrists, Earl is able to tear one hand free. Then he pulls away the rest of the duct tape from his knees. The tape is still wrapped tightly around    his neck, pinning him to the backrest. Earl claws     at the tape, it won't come free. Finally, with both     hands, he reac behind his head and yanks the read rest    from the seat. He reaches into his boot for something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is spread-eagled on the ground. Sheriff Boyd calls out to Earl in the cab. He keeps his gun leveled. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You there -- in the pickup! You all right? Can you get out? EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Just don't shoot me, officer! He's crazy, I tell you! SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, get out dammit! JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, please. You gotta listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances down at Jeff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (to Earl) C'mon out, sir. It's safe -- Earl sets one foot on the road. The headrest dangles against his back, still taped to his neck. Suddenly Earl whirls, holding a .22 snub-nose REVOLVER and FIRES! The sheriff stumbles away, blood spurting from his shoulder, the gun flying from his hand. Jeff looks up in horror as the sheriff falls.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Earl comes around the pickup after Jeff, raising the gun to fire. Jeff scrambles to his feet and dives down the embankment. Earl runs to the edge of the embankment. Down below, Jeff is reaching for the automatic pistol the sheriff ordered him to drop. He finds it... too late... Earl is aiming at point-blank range from the top of the embankment. He is already squeezing the trigger when... BLAM! Earl's chest erupts outward as a bullet passes through his body from behind! Earl staggers and flops down the embankment. He comes to rest near Jeff, blood gurgling from a massive chest wound. Jeff climbs the embankment. The sheriff is lying on the road, critically injured, gun lying nearby and still smoking from the shot that killed Earl. The sheriff is struggling to speak into a remote transmitter strapped to his uniform. SHERIFF BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) Shots fired... Officer down... Suspect... DISPATCHER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help is on the way, Sheriff. Just hang on. I have units and an ambulance en route. Jeff bends over the Sheriff and examines his wound with a grimace. He is verging on unconsciousness. Jeff deliberates, torn. There is nothing he can do here. Making up his mind, Jeff runs to the pickup. The hand- held cellular phone has spilled into the road. He scoops it up, jumps behind the wheel and LAYS RUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff stands on a ridge overlooking a Texaco truck stop. Behind him, the Dodge Ram pickup lies hidden in a growth of scrub oak and tumbleweeds. Jeff looks overwhelmed by what he sees spread out below.

dialogues.speaker: TEXACO TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: It's a giant truck stop. There are hundreds of big rigs parked in rows like silvery sardines. A sign towers over the main building:    "DIESEL $.99 GAL

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: He looks shaken. How will he ever find Red here?    It seems impossible. He descends the bluff to the truck stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff skids on his heels down the loose hillside and reaches the edge of the parking lot. There are trucks everywhere. Diesel MOTORS RUMBLE. Exhaust fills the air. He reaches the end of a row of big rigs, starts searching the grounds for the markings of Red's 18-wheeler. It's nowhere in sight. A high-pitched FEMININE SQUEAL from an adjacent truck's sleeping compartment startles Jeff. TRUCKER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) C'mon, baby, give it up! The woman GIGGLES, O.S. Jeff ignores it, scanning the truck stop. He stiffens. A police car is arriving at the truck stop. Staying out of sight, Jeff passes quickly to the rear of a tractor trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff peers out from behind a parked mini-van as trucks emerge wet and dripping from an immense truck wash. Across the way, trucks are filling up on diesel at the gas islands. Jeff's eyes narrow. Is that Red's Peterbilt among them? He quickens his pace, then falls back, slumping. The rig's black driver is getting in the cab. Jeff glances to the side, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An older vacationing couple is eyeing Jeff warily. Jeff looks down, cops to it instantly. His clothes are ripped, caked with blood. He ducks between two parked cars, using a side-view mirror as he hastily wipes blood off his face. He checks to be sure no one is watching. Something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A highway patrol car with flashing lights is parked near the place where Jeff ditched the pickup. Beside it, a state trooper surveys the truck stop with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff's jaw tightens. He glances toward the road, sees two more highway patrol cars cruising the perimeter of the truck stop. Swearing, Jeff turns on his heels and walks away in the opposite direction, shielding his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff emerges from between two vehicles, glancing over his shoulder nervously. He keeps his head down, moving fast. He scans the truck stop in all directions. The patrol car is still parked on the ridge, the patrolman peering through binoculars. Jeff quickens his pace alongside the truck stop building, passing a row of pay phones. He looks up, stops dead. Red is talking on a pay phone six feet away. Jeff stares. Red is facing away, unaware of his presence. Jeff darts into an adjacent pay phone. He shields his face with the receiver and listens. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) I don't know, dammit, he was supposed to be here a half hour ago. There's reports on the police band about a cop down and this place is crawling with uniforms...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Red waits, listens. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm getting out of here. Stay off the airwaves. Bring the girl and meet me at the barn... You got that? He hangs up.   Jeff presses the phone against his face an turns away. When he looks up, Red is walking toward his Peterbilt truck, parked in a row of big rigs. Jeff starts to follow, then freezes. Several cops are fanning out on foot, questioning everyone they encounter. Jeff sees Red getting into his truck. The ENGINE KICKS OVER. The BRAKES HISS and the truck begins pulling out. Jeff whips around. The older vacationing couple are talking to a cop fifty yards away. The husband points toward the pay phones. Jeff makes a sudden decision, doubles back behind a rolling farm truck.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: thanks the couple, calls out something to his fellow officers.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: runs alongside the farm truck, using it as a shield. He overtakes the truck, cuts across its path. The farmer BLARES his HORN. Jeff glances left. Red's tractor trailer is traveling across the crowded parking area, slowly gaining speed. Jeff sprints in front of a moving car. The driver jerks to a halt and HONKS, catching the attention of a nearby cop. Jeff quickly turns away, avoiding being seen. Red's 18-wheeler turns toward the access road. Jeff looks around, panicked. More cops are spreading out on foot. They'll notice him any second.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff crouches low and scurries underneath a slow-moving postal truck. The truck speeds up, nearly crushing him under the rear wheel assembly. Jeff rolls out of the path of the giant wheels, gets to his feet on the other side and finds himself... ... in the path of another huge truck! A cop is standing only 20 feet away! Jeff goes underneath another trailer, crawling between the moving wheels. He springs to his feet. Red's Peterbilt is pulling away! Jeff runs for all he's worth. His arms and legs pump furiously. He runs abreast of the truck... ... and seizes the spare tire mount!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hangs on for dear life. His legs drag over the asphalt. He lets out a cry of pain. The truck is joining the highway, accelerating. Grimacing, Jeff swings his legs over the universal joint as the roadway races past below. The huge TIRES are a HOWLING blur. Suddenly his grip falters on the grease. His back scrapes the rushing asphalt. Jeff gasps, makes a grab and holds firm. As he hangs on, a station wagon overtakes the Peterbilt in the passing lane. A three-year-old boy sits in the rear compartment, staring out at Jeff, a puzzled expression on his face. Jeff stares back. It's an odd moment between the two. The station wagon continues forward and EXITS FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PETERBILT THUNDERS over a patch of highway that is being graded for paving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tires kick up a hail storm of loose gravel and dirt, pelting Jeff all over his body. He realizes he can't stay where he is. Grunting with effort, he works his way hand over hand along the underside rigging toward the cab. He seizes the trailer hitch and hoists himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the coupler, Jeff clutches his ribs and catches his breath. He's in pain. The road whips by below his feet. The truck hits an uneven stretch of road and bounces violently. Jeff grabs the coiled brake line for support. The truck is doing 70 mph, exhaust racketing. Jeff pulls the cell phone from his pocket and dials 911. He holds it tightly to his ear, shouting above the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Can you hear me? This is Jeff Taylor. I need to talk to the deputy. He strains to hear the reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is Jeffrey Taylor. I just witnessed your sheriff being shot. Now put someone on, goddammit! He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red glances in the side mirror at the road behind him as he drives, unaware of Jeff's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff clutches the cell phone to his ear, waiting.    He reacts suddenly as the call is put through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Carver speaks on a phone extension while the DISPATCHER sits nearby. DEPUTY CARVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no good. He's not talking. You better mobilize your boys. The troopers stare back.    They look like they have a score to settle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck streaks along the interstate.   Sitting on the coupler, Jeff is a picture of despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later. The truck races toward the bloated lowering sun, with no sign of slowing down. Jeff lies curled under the windfoil on the roof of the cab. He hugs himself, shivering in the cold draft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACTOR TRAILER RUMBLES in low gear along a sparsely populated two-lane road. A neighborhood DOG YAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his hiding place under the windfoil, Jeff peers out into the darkness, unable to figure out where he is. He catches his balance as the truck turns a corner and slows, driving past a tract of undeveloped land, before turning into the driveway of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and braking to a halt under the broad overhanging eave of an old dilapidated barn.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind the two-story farm house, a rusted Volkswagen bus and satellite dish hunker in the weeds. A newer car, a 1981 Cadillac Deville, is parked to the side. Red kills the engine and climbs out of the cab. As he walks toward the house, a screen DOOR SLAPS. DEKE, 9, squirts across the lawn in his pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, you're home! Red scoops him up. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Deke, you miss me? ARLEEN, 35, comes out of the house in a bathrobe. ARLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke, get back to bed! I said now! (to Red) Warren? I thought you were coming back next week. She comes out into the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff flattens against the sleeper. He can see Red greeting his wife, their words carrying faintly across the lawn. Jeff is baffled by this domestic scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arleen reacts with disappointment to something Red's told her. ARLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but it's four in the morning. Why can't Al and Billy come some other time? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reasoning) I told you, we've got some stuff to take care of. Won't be more than a couple of hours -- I promise. Red turns to his son, extends a key.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Deke, how 'bout opening up the barn for your daddy? Deke takes the key and sprints for the barn while Red returns to the cab, passing within several feet of Jeff's hiding place. He reaches into the cab, brings out a duffel bag and unzips it. Jeff keeps his breathing shallow, squeezes against the windfoil. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke, c'mon over here, I got something for you. Deke runs up, breathless. Red holds two hands behind his back. Red and Deke are just six feet from Jeff. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess which hand. DEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to right hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one. Red opens his right hand.    Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.    Try again. DEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to left) This hand. Red opens his left.    Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's been tricked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'll give it to you. He opens his hand, revealing Jeff's Swiss Army knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Deke takes the knife and runs off. Red goes to the rear of the trailer, unlocks it and raises the slatted door. He hops up inside. His FOOTSTEPS ECHO in the metal trailer. We hear him SHIFTING BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff seizes his chance. He crawls out from under the windfoil and hoists himself onto the overhanging eave. The STRUCTURE CREAKS under his weight.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TRAILER
dialogues.text: Red sticks his head out of the trailer, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke?   Deke, you back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff crouches in the shadows. He can see Red poking his head out from the trailer, peering up at the roof.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TRAILER
dialogues.text: Red shrugs, lets it go. He resumes unloading boxes, tosses down a full set of Louis Vuitton luggage. He lugs the items into the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff goes to a second-story window. A board has been nailed over the window. He pulls it away, steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and looks around, amazed.     Everywhere around him there are stolen goods. Matching luggage sets... a rack of women's coats... a table piled with cameras... a crate filled with car phones... A stack of windshields... two sets of golf clubs... three child safety seats... a ten-speed bicycle...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Several dozen "COMMERCIAL VEHICLE" license plates are scattered about -- Arkansas, Oregon, Texas, Iowa, South Dakota... As Jeff stares, reeling, there is a RUMBLE outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red looks up from toting a box of car stereos and snarled wiring as the moving van and Pontiac Firebird arrive at the barn. He beckons for the vehicles to pull forward into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al dismounts from the moving truck. Billy climbs out of the Firebird. They are travel-sore, stretching. Red shuts the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, if I never see another couple from Massachusetts it'll be too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.   You get any word on Earl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's reports of an accident up Five Mile, but that's about it. Red grunts, unlatches the door to the moving van, lowers a ramp. The three men begin unloading boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lies on his belly peering through a knothole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men unload Jeff and Amy's belongings -- luggage, photography equipment, miscellaneous items. Inside the moving van, the battered Jeep Cherokee is visible, partially covered with a tarp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we shoulda gotten rid of 'em like that couple up in Utah. Nice and clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it got a little fucked up -- so what? We stay out of the area for a while, things will cool off. There is a HAMMERING noise, O.S.    Red looks over, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Al, what the hell you doing? Al sits at a workbench hammering precious stones out of Amy's jewelry. He looks over at Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured I'd get started on the jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, you can work on it later. Help us with the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff breathes in sharply, presses his eye against the knothole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red unlatches a hidden compartment under the chassis of the moving truck. He and Billy slide out a long metal box, similar to a drawer in a morgue. They lift the metal lid, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: CANVAS SACK
dialogues.text: The sack is stained and ripped.    Red pokes at it.   The sack doesn't move. Red shrugs. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've died from the exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff stares, paralyzed, his universe exploded.   Moisture forms in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and Al reach into the compartment, start to lift out the sack. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some plastic. We'll bury her before it gets light out. Suddenly the sack drives its legs into Al's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aagh! Al falls backward, drops the sack on the floor. It tears open revealing Amy -- gagged with duct tape, her wrists and ankles taped. She squirms and kicks wildly, her screams muffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jeff's eye in the knothole. It's all we need to see to gauge the effect on him of seeing Amy alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al gets to his feet, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn.   Scared me half to death. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Gotcha good, huh, Al? Oughta be more careful next time. AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (glaring at Amy) Lemme do her, Red. I'll cut her head off right now. ARLEEN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Warren? You in there? Red reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's my wife. Help me get her in the freezer. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, Arleen. Red walks to a corner, moves aside a section of false flooring. He pulls up a hidden trap door, revealing a root cellar.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: squirms on the hay-strewn floor. Her clothes are ripped, face bruised. She looks up, reacting: Jeff's eye is visible in the knothole. Their gaze meets... and holds...

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: returns and takes Amy by the legs. Al and Billy lift her by the arms. As they carry her to the root cellar, Red peers into her terrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't   worry, honey. It's not as bad as   it sounds. It'll take you about   10 minutes to suck the air out.    Probably won't even feel it. Amy reacts, writhing even more violently, but she's no match for the three men.

dialogues.speaker: BARN HAYLOFT
dialogues.text: Jeff watches helplessly as...

dialogues.speaker: BARN GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: The men disappear with Amy into the cellar. We hear a METALLIC THUD, then a few moments later, the men reappear without her. Red closes the trap door, secures it with a heavy padlock, then slides the panel of false flooring over it. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go. They turn, walk toward the door. Red opens it. Arleen is standing there. Al and Billy greet her politely:

dialogues.speaker: AL BILLY
dialogues.text: Howdy, Arleen.                     Hey, Missus C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well finally. Are you coming to breakfast? I've been calling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, honey. The barn goes dark as the men leave.        The barn door shut. A LOCK CLICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff quickly climbs down a ladder in the pitch darkness. He crosses the room, bumping into a workbench. He swears, makes his way toward the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drops to his hands and knees, feeling for the padlocked trap door. He finds it, speaks in an urgent whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy?   Amy, can you hear me? No reply.     Jeff cups his hands, presses his mouth to t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy? Still no reply. Jeff swears, glances around the dark room.       There is tool bench across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, baby. They're in the house; I can't use the lights. I'm gonna get you out. He goes to   the tool bench, fumbling in the darkness. He knocks over   a cardboard box -- a pile of car keys spill across the   table. His hands run over an assortment of tools.  He   locates a hammer, takes it. Returning to the trap door, Jeff inserts the claw in the padlock and tries to pry it open. The lock won't give.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He strains, using all his strength.     Suddenly the hand snaps! Jeff flies backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! He gets up, goes to the tool bench. His hands feel over and reject an assortment of small tools. He finds a crowbar, returns to the trap door and inserts it into the shackle, twisting with all his might. After several failed attempts, he swears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not working. If I make any more noise, they'll hear. Jeff mulls his options.    He sets his jaw, exhales. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get you out of there, Amy. He swallows, emotional, clearly torn. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. (under his breath) Please, God, let her still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff opens the door. A weak dome light flickers on. He climbs up into the cab and tries turning on the CB radio, but no luck -- the keys are gone. He opens the glove compartment. There are maps, trip logs, truck stop receipts. He rifles through them quickly. Jeff frowns, gets on the floor of the cab and gropes under the driver's seat. His eyes register a discovery. He brings out a big black semi-automatic pistol. Jeff studies the base of the grip, clearly unfamiliar with guns. He fumbles with the clip, ejects it. The clip is full of bullets. He snaps the clip back in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff climbs out of the window onto the broad overhanging eave. He steps to the edge of the roof and lowers himself onto the Peterbilt cab, then drops to the ground. He looks around. Red's is the only house visible. A light flickers in the trees a mile away. It could be anything. Jeff moves toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff holds the gun ready as he eases open the screen door. The DOOR CREAKS on its hinges. Jeff steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lets the door close silently. There are VOICES coming from a distant room. He passes a washing machine, a hamper full of dirty clothes, and moves silently down...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: toward the voices. VIDEO GAME sound effects emanate from a room off the hall. Jeff flattens against the wall, peers into the living room. Seated on the floor with his back   to Jeff, Deke is playing Nintendo on a wide-screen   television.  Various items are scattered about: stereo    speakers, a jukebox, brand new Nordic Track. There is    a rifle rack across t room. Stepping past the doorway, Jeff continues down the hall toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red is in the middle of telling a story.    Arleen, Billy and Al sit around the table.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The plates are cleared away.       They are drinking beer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So there I am, it's a howling snow storm, I've got 2000 live chickens that are supposed to be in Denver days ago, and this cop is busting my balls because I haven't got chains... Arleen and the men laugh heartily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happens but   this big old rooster, damn thing   must've weighed ten pounds,   he reaches out toward that highway   patrolman... Al glances toward the door, stops laughing.         Billy Arleen follow his gaze, go silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just reaches out with his beak, see, and... Red notices his audience is no longer paying attention. He turns in his chair, sees --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway. Aiming the pistol. His clothes caked with blood and dirt. He sways slightly. Nobody else moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (placating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold on, mister. I don't know who you are or what you want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the fucking key! There is silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mister me, you sonofabitch! My wife is locked in a hole in your fucking barn! You don't give me the key, I'll blow your fucking head off! Arleen glances at Red, frightened. ARLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clueless) Warren? What's going on? RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey.        Just stay calm -- JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Arleen) Your husband's a kidnapper and a murderer is what's going on! Did you know that about him? Huh? (gestures) Ever wonder where all this stuff comes from? Arleen looks up at Jeff, scared.      She starts to open mouth, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick 'em up. Jeff turns. Nine-year-old Deke is aiming a rifle at Jeff from the hallway. The rifle looks enormous in his hands. The boy's lip quivers. The room is silent. No one moves. Jeff keeps the pistol aimed at Red. He swallows, speaks slowly: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to do that, kid. Just put the gun down. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) Don't listen to him, Deke.        Keep the gun on him. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the gun down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice quavering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy keeps his rifle loaded all the time. He showed me in case I needed to protect Mommy when he's away. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that, Deke. I'm not gonna hurt Mommy. But if you pull that trigger, there's a chance I'll still kill your father. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying, Deke. He can't get me. Just pull the trigger. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Deke, don't listen to him. He's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plug him, boy!     Do what I tell you! Deke looks at his father, fights back tears.        His f tightens on the trigger. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, boy.       Do it.   Don't worry about me. Deke whimpers, squeezes the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke, no -- ! Suddenly, Billy bolts from the table. The RIFLE FIRES! The recoil knocks Deke off his feet. The bullet rips into Al's shoulder! AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww -- goddammit, you little shit! Red is out of his chair. Jeff dives first and seizes the rifle. He whirls, aims the pistol at Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking move! Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff sidesteps to the window. Billy is running across the yard. Is he headed for the barn? Jeff swears, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke?   Deke?   Get on your feet! Deke rises, tears streaming down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, kid. Go over there, stand next to your mother. Hurry up. Deke obeys. Clutching his shoulder wound, Al glares at the child as he passes. Jeff deliberates. Where the hell was Billy going? gnaws his lip, decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... on your feet.   Now, everybody! Red, Arleen and Al get to their feet. Deke stays at his mother's side. Jeff aims the pistol at Red, holds the rifle with his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.      Out. He herds them to the door.      Arleen looks to Red nervously. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do like he says, Arleen.      He's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff trains the pistol as his captives stand at the entrance to the barn. He glances around, keeping an eye out for Billy. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Red) Okay. Reach into your pocket and hand the key to your wife. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't gonna work, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jams pistol at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Red fishes a key ring out of his pocket and extends it to Arleen. She just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Arleen.      Take it. She takes the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating barn door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now unlock it. Arleen inserts a key, opens the padlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Now give me the keys. (turning to Deke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke, push the door open. Quickly. Deke looks at his father. Red nods.         Deke goes to door, begins wheeling it open. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Deke. (gesturing them inside with gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Move it. Jeff herds all four into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff leads the group through the barn at gun-point. He glances right and left, wired. The rifle is strapped to his back. He keeps the handgun ready. He peers under the tractor-trailer, looking for any sign of Billy. They reach the trap door. Jeff circles it, constantly keeping an eye on Red and Al. He hands the keys to Deke. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke, I need you to open this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Deke looks at his father. He kneels, unlocks the padlock and heaves open the trap door, revealing a narrow staircase slanting into the cellar. Deke looks down into the darkness and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Deke. There's a freezer down there with a woman in it. I need you to let her out. Deke descends the steps, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice quavering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see. Jeff jabs the pistol at Red:    Tell him where the light is. RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, to Deke) The switch is on the right. There's a CLICK and the light goes on in the cellar. Deke lets out a yip of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, son.     Just ignore that stuff. Jeff crouches to peer into the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: CELLAR
dialogues.text: Roots and mildew hang in strings from the ceiling. The light is a bare bulb. There are several distressingly- shaped garbage bags against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: His gaze shifts back to Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Deke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke!    You at the freezer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're almost done. Just open it up, let the woman out. We hear a FREEZER BEING OPENED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all tied up with tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that Swiss Army knife your dad gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man. Use that.   Make sure you don't hurt her. They wait tensely while Deke works downstairs. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Red) You better pray she's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!!??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy!!! AMY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost free!!! JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, come up here! Amy climbs the stairs quickly. Scraps of duct tape cling to her wrists. She throws her arm around Jeff. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were going to kill me. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, baby. It's okay.       They can't hurt you now. While Amy embraces him, Jeff keeps the gun on Red and the others. He gestures toward the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Red, Arleen, and Al)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Everybody in the cellar. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Arleen and Al descend the steps.        Red follows, then stops, halfway down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember this moment, pretty boy. 'Cause whatever happens, no matter how far you run, I will hunt you down and kill you like a dog. Jeff stares back.       A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell. He boots Red in the chest, sending him backward down the steps. He slams the trap door shut and locks the padlock. He looks around, sees a massive tool chest.         He ti onto the trap door -- crash! Then he takes Amy's hand, still keeping an eye out for Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here. They run from the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of sunlight are beginning to poke over the horizon. Jeff wheels the barn door shut and locks it.         He s running toward Red's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, no!    It's not safe -- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) But there's a phone inside.         We have to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them's still loose.      C'mon -- this way! It's too much to explain. Jeff grabs her arm. As they take off running toward the light flickering in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL BILLY
dialogues.text: lurking in the shadows at the corner of the barn, watching.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Jeff and Amy are tiny figures sprinting across the flat terrain, illuminated by the red glow of a rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sky is lighter now. A rickety trailer surrounded by a chicken coop, junked appliances and a clothesline. There's an old utility pickup truck parked in front. Jeff and Amy arrive out of breath. Jeff pounds on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Hello?     Anybody home? There's no answer. Jeff puts his shoulder to the door and rams it open. The flimsy door gives way easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff enters. The place is ramshackle -- torn vinyl furniture, empty beer bottles scattered about. A tattered flag hangs on the wall. There's no one around. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Hello? Anyone home? Amy follows him inside, looks around. Jeff crosses the room, snatches up a phone and dials 911. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: While he waits for an answer, Amy leans the rifle against the wall. She notices a set of car keys hanging by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: keys) Take it. We may need to get out of here -- (into phone, suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! This is Jeff Taylor. I'm reporting an emergency... I don't know the address, the house belongs to a Red Barr -- I mean, Warren something... No, I don't know his name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly hearing something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff -- A DEEP RUMBLE is approaching, GETTING LOUDER by the second... JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- he kidnapped my wife, he's locked in a barn... Jeffrey Taylor. If you contact the police in -- Amy pulls a curtain aside, reacts to what she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff! Suddenly, the ROAR is DEAFENING -- The PETERBILT EXPLODES through the wall of the trailer home!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF AND AMY
dialogues.text: dive out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the truck cab, we catch a glimpse of Red behind the wheel, shouting something inaudible. Fragments of debris cling to the grille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rickety structure spins 360 degrees! Jeff goes flying. A TELEVISION somersaults across the room and EXPLODES. Amy slams into a wall. The speeding Peterbilt shears away a section of the trailer home with a horrible RIPPING sound! The trailer home is suddenly open to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red puts the truck into a hard turn, circling for another run at the devastated trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff struggles to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy?! Amy is crawling over the debris. Jeff pulls her to her feet. He grabs the rifle and car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! They stagger through the gaping hole in the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red sees Amy and Jeff flee the trailer and head for the utility pickup. He throws the Peterbilt into a turn.

dialogues.speaker: YARD
dialogues.text: Amy and Jeff run for the Ford F100 utility truck -- an aging blue-collar workhorse equipped with side-mounted toolboxes and a lumber rack bearing a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Jeff keys the ignition. The ENGINE SPUTTERS. Amy whips around to see the Peterbilt bearing down from the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, go!    Go!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff turns the key. The ENGINE CATCHES!   He throws the Ford in gear and floors the gas. The Ford shoots out of the Peterbilt's path!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The FORD PEELS OUT of the driveway and joins the road, spewing exhaust. It's an old vehicle that doesn't maneuver well.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Jeff mashes the gas pedal. The ENGINE STRAINS, BACKFIRING. Amy looks back, sees the Peterbilt joining the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't this thing go any faster?! A SHOTGUN BLAST SHATTERS the passenger WINDOW! Amy screams as glass showers the cab. Jeff swerves wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! He swivels his head right, sees --

dialogues.speaker: FIREBIRD
dialogues.text: kicking up a cloud of dust as it pulls alongside the Ford on the right-hand shoulder. The driver, Billy, is levelling a shotgun through the window.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: cranks the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: IN FIREBIRD
dialogues.text: Billy triggers a BLAST!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: yelps as the passenger-side MIRROR DISINTEGRATES!    She whips around, sees --

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC DEVILLE
dialogues.text: pulling even with them on Jeff's side. The drive, Al, leers as he spins the wheel and creases the Ford --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: raises the PISTOL and FIRES!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Ford is sandwiched between the Cadillac and Firebird as they race down the highway with the Peterbilt in the rear.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: lets out a cry as they carom off the Cadillac. Blood flows in a trickle down his neck. Amy sees it, panicking. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's glass!   Use the rifle! Amy raises the rifle, thrusts the barrel awkwardly out the window and aims at Billy. She FIRES wildly -- BANG!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: grins as the SHOT WHISTLES past harmlessly. He reloads the SHOTGUN, snaps it shut and RETURNS FIRE -- BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The BLAST hits the Ford's side-mounted toolbox.     The d flies open. Tools scatter on the road!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: veers away, swearing, as hammers and chisels and power tools hit the asphalt and bounce up into his path. The front end of the extension ladder comes free from the lumber rack and hinges into his path, SMASHING the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch! Billy swears and jerks the wheel, steering away. He glances up suddenly, sees Jeff aiming the pistol. The PISTOL FIRES! Billy slams backward against the headrest, hit in the face. There's blood everywhere. The car careens toward the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Firebird hits a mound of earth, flies through the air and lands with a CRASH!

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red sees the crash, scowling. He presses the gas and pulls closer, taking Billy's place alongside the Ford.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Amy sees the Peterbilt advancing. Whipping her head to the other side, she sees Al raising a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Al jacks the trigger -- BLAM!    BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: ON PETERBILT
dialogues.text: a STRAY BULLET SLICES the hydraulic brake line running to the trailer. The HOSE HISSES and whips through the air!

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red swears and lets the truck fall back, swearing. Up ahead is a long, curving downgrade. He taps the brakes. There is a jolt as the trailer bumps the tractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch -- He realizes:    The trailer's got no brakes.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Peterbilt descends the grade, letting out a RAPID- FIRE BLAT of BACKFIRES. It's gaining speed, bearing down on the Ford.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Amy turns in the seat, terrified. The truck looms closer. Jeff keeps the gas pedal on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on! They are flying into a hairy curve.

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red struggles to stay in control. Every time he applies the brakes, the unchecked trailer jars the cab forward. The Peterbilt races into the curve. Red has no choice. He has to pump the brakes and risk jackknifing or the truck will fly off the road altogether. He hits the brakes!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The huge TRUCK SCREECHES on the asphalt, tires smoking, cab and trailer folding at right angles! Then, unexpectedly, the trailer disconnects from the cab!

dialogues.speaker: IN CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Flanking the Peterbilt, Al glances to the side and sees the trailer come untethered from the cab. Now the trailer is an unguided missile, weaving drunkenly back and forth across the blacktop. Al tries to swerve away. The trailer streaks toward him. Al SLAMS on the BRAKES, screaming!

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The trailer piles into the Cadillac. There is a huge IMPACT as trailer and Cadillac are reduced to scrap metal! And just as this is happening...

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: blasts into the rear of the Ford, jarring it forward with a CRUNCH of METAL and taillights!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: slams against the wheel. Amy is thrown against the dashboard. The Ford is being propelled downhill by the Peterbilt.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The two vehicles are now locked together, gaining speed as they hurtle down the grade.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: jams the pistol through the rear pass-through window and FIRES at Red in the truck. BULLETS PING off the grille. The GUN CLICKS empty.

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red hits the brakes, but it's no use. The bumpers are meshed. The two vehicles plunge downhill, skidding sideways. Up ahead, a concrete bridge spans a deep gorge.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Peterbilt and Ford fly onto the bridge. The big truck glances off a railing. The vehicles suddenly come unlocked. The FORD plows into the concrete railing with a CRASH! The PETERBILT creams it from behind and caroms away, SKIDDING the length of the bridge before SMACKING the opposite railing!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ROAD
dialogues.text: Jeff grimaces. In front of them, the concrete railing has broken away. Debris falls 300 feet to the bottom of the gorge. The Ford's right front tire hangs in the air. Jeff looks at Amy.   She looks wildly adrenalated, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? Amy looks back at him.   She expels a long breath and nods. Jeff forces his upper body through the driver's window and looks over the Ford's roof at the Peterbilt.

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: It's facing them, 50 yards away on the bridge. The engine is dead. STEAM HISSES from the crumpled radiator. One tire is shredded. There is blood on the broken windshield.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: sitting in the driver's window. He squints toward the truck, searching for any sign of Red. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? AMY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff... I can't get out... Jeff drops back into the cab. The dashboard is crushed against Amy's legs. She tries to wriggle free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wriggling) It's just... I can't get out... JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I can't get out! Jeff blinks. He climbs out of the Ford, runs around to Amy's side and yanks the door. It comes open with a CREAK of METAL. Behind Jeff on the bridge, a MOTOR KICKS OVER.   He whirls.

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: EXHAUST BELCHES from the smokestacks. Red is behind the wheel. His face is covered with blood. He stares hatefully. With a RASP of GEARS, the Peterbilt lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEFF
dialogues.text: He pushes against the dashboard with life-or-death urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Amy, push! Amy struggles and struggles to free her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push, goddammit! Amy glances toward the Peterbilt, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: creeps toward the Ford. The truck's grille is smashed. One wheel RIM SCRAPES the asphalt. It gains speed.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Jeff crawls over Amy and tries pushing with his legs. She winces as the metal cuts into her skin. Jeff strains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning, reacting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: rams the rear of the FORD -- CRASH! It jars the pickup farther through broken concrete guardrail.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Jeff and Amy are thrown forward by the impact. The Peterbilt's ENGINE ROARS. It's pushing them over the edge!

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red's eyes burn as he presses the accelerator and forces the pickup farther through the broken railing.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: lurches through the widening gap in the railing. Concrete sails into the canyon. The front tires hang over the void.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Jeff strains against the dashboard. It won't give.     He whips around, swearing, and leaps from the Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff?

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Jeff runs to the Peterbilt and jumps on the driver's side running board, grasping the door handle. Red heaves the door open suddenly. It strikes Jeff's head with a crack! He falls backward to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red presses the gas, yelling over the ENGINE ROAR. The railing is giving way. He sees Jeff struggling to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can come into my life and fuck with me? Nobody fucks with me!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks down.   Jeff is no longer visible.   Red frowns. Suddenly the passenger side door flies open and Jeff surges into the cab, landing on Red, clawing at his eyes! They grapple in the cab. Red swings an elbow into Jeff's face -- crack. Jeff drives a fist to his jaw! The steering wheel drifts counter-clockwise as the truck inches forward, ramming the Ford closer to the precipice. Red gets his hands around Jeff's neck as the steering wheel continues to move counter-clockwise...

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The truck is no longer hitting the Ford squarely. Instead, the Peterbilt's right front tire is riding up and over the cargo bed, crushing the left side of the Ford under its massive weight.

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red has both hands around Jeff's windpipe.    He glances for a second, reacts, but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The Peterbilt is surging up the driver's side of the Ford, using the pickup like a ramp!

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Amy screams as the left side of the cab is flattened under the Peterbilt's weight!

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: For an instant, the Peterbilt's front tires seem to hang in the air... then the truck is falling!

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Red and Jeff are thrown forward in the cab, still flailing at each other, as the truck plunges nose-first into the gorge. Then it jerks to a halt in mid-air!

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The left rear set of wheels on the trailer is snagged on the thick rebar reinforcement in the crumbled concrete railing. The Peterbilt is dangling nose-down from the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: IN PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Jeff slams into the windshield. Red lands on top of him. Loose objects from the cab rain against the windshield. They grapple. Red grabs Jeff's arm and twists sharply, forcing it at an impossible angle. Their faces are inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can fuck with me?! He headbutts Jeff viciously -- crack! Blood erupts from Jeff's nose and mouth. Red is about to deliver another blow when... ... the windshield falls away! The loose items in the cab plummet 300 feet to the canyon floor below. Jeff drops through the windshield opening. He clings to the center support column. His legs dangle over the hood. Red slips through the opening, his hand locking on the steering wheel at the last instant. The windshield sails away into the gorge.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The iron REBAR GROANS. It's beginning to give way under the weight of the truck. The truck slips slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ON PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Jeff feels the truck shifting. He grabs the windshield wiper blade with his free hand. The blade snaps away. Red is clinging to the steering wheel. He flails at Jeff with his feet, swearing. Jeff is barely out of reach. Jeff looks to the side. There is a grabhandle on the corner of the cab. He reaches with his free hand and seizes the handle.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The REBAR GROANS. The truck is wedged against the Ford. As the truck slips, it forces the Ford closer to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: ON PETERBILT
dialogues.text: Jeff clings to the handle. He reaches for the passenger side door handle, working his way up toward the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: REBAR
dialogues.text: gives away once more and --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: scales the cab, finding more handholds.   He climbs past the passenger door. Behind him, Red is working his way higher in the same manner. He grabs Jeff's foot, trying to pull him off the cab. Jeff kicks free and climbs past the sleeping compartment. Red grabs the door handle. Jeff boots the door release button. The passenger door flies open! Red falls away as the door opens. He's clinging to the open passenger door, suspended over the gorge.

dialogues.speaker: IN FORD
dialogues.text: Amy breathes in sharply, feeling the Ford move closer to the edge. She struggles to free her legs from the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: climbs higher. The Peterbilt slips again.    Below, Red loses his grip and almost falls. Jeff hauls himself onto the bridge with a final gasp of exertion. He runs to the passenger side of the Ford.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Ford teeters precariously. Any move could send it over the edge. Jeff can only extend his hand to Amy over the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Amy, it's all you now... you can do it... With a huge effort, Amy frees herself from the dashboard and reaches for Jeff's outstretched hand just as --

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: comes free from the rebar!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: takes hold of Jeff's hand.

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: plummets into the canyon!

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: screams!

dialogues.speaker: PETERBILT
dialogues.text: seems to fall forever... before landing with a huge

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Jeff and Amy fall backward on the road. Down below, secondary EXPLOSIONS rock the canyon. Jeff takes Amy in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me go, Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't, baby... I won't ever let you go... He looks into her eyes.   Their lips meet in a kiss and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars and official vehicles are parked outside the house. RADIOS CHATTER. Yellow crime tape holds back onlookers and news reporters. Cops and evidence technicians work the scene. A criminalist photographs stolen property as it's carried out of the barn. A plainclothes FBI AGENT closes a cellphone and walks over to where Jeff and Amy are sitting at a picnic table. They are battered and bandaged. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the sheriff? FBI AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of surgery. It looks like he's gonna make it. As for the wife and kid, she's not talking, he's being turned over to Protective Services. Jeff nods soberly. FBI AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got I.D. on the dead suspects. Turns out they were all licensed truckers. One of 'em had a rap for check kiting. Otherwise they could've been model citizens. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the leader? FBI AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing. His real name's Warren Claney. Three speeding tickets in five years -- apart from that, he's clean as a whistle. Amy watches as cops stack windshields outside the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) How could they do it? How could they treat it like a... business? FBI AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I don't know. I've been doing this 15 years, I've never seen anything like it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was simple, efficient and organized. They stayed on the move, spread it over a dozen states. As long as no witnesses survived, it's an untraceable crime. (looking at them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just a couple of the lucky ones. Up ahead, a television news helicopter is landing on the road. A cameraman, reporter and producer hurry over. Jeff watches the news crew, a bemused expression.   It seems like a million years ago... The FBI Agent shakes his head, disdainful. FBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: media) C'mon -- let's get you folks out of here before things really get hairy. He escorts them to a waiting sedan. As they climb in, Jeff looks back over his shoulder, surveying the scene one last time. He gets in and the car pulls away just as the frenzied news crew arrives, mikes and cameras at the ready, running alongside the departing sedan, shouting questions. Through the rear window, we see Jeff putting his arm around Amy, pulling her close as we hear: AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me one thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time... we fly.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Over this last line, the sedan drives away, and we CLIMB HIGHER and HIGHER AWAY FROM the bristling crime scene until the ranch house is just one in a town of modest houses and the pink desert floor spreads out endlessly in every direction.
